member.summary: A resolver that returns the given name with no modifications. Note that this resolver is intrinsically meaningful in that always operates on the originally passed name, rather than what's currently in the candidate list (as this would be pointless).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Core.Loader.DefaultPathResolver.BaseDirectoryResolver

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Core.Loader.DefaultPathResolver.RuntimesFolderResolver
member.summary: A resolver that, given an absolute or relative path, searches for a "runtimes" folder in the directory represented by the given name for a file matching the given path's file name in one of the applicable RID-specific runtimes folders applicable to the current dependency context.

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Core.Loader.DefaultPathResolver.LinuxVersioningResolver
member.summary: A resolver that returns less version-specific Linux shared object names. That is, given a string of "libglfw.so.3.3.6", this resolver will return "libglfw.so.3.3", "libglfw.so.3", and "libglfw.so" (in that order).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Core.Loader.DefaultPathResolver.MacVersioningResolver
member.summary: A resolver that returns less version-specific macOS dynamic library names. That is, given a string of "libglfw.3.3.6.dylib", this resolver will return "libglfw.3.3.dylib", "libglfw.3.dylib", and "libglfw.dylib" (in that order).

member.name: F:Silk.NET.Core.Loader.DefaultPathResolver.NativePackageResolver
member.summary: A resolver that searches the restored NuGet packages for the current executable for a file matching the given file name in one of the applicable RID-specific runtimes folders applicable to the current dependency context.

member.name: T:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock
member.summary: Provided a lightweight spin lock for synchronization in high performance scenarios with a low hold time
member.remarks: This lock is very performant, but it is very dangerous (hence breakneck). It's recommended to use the framework-provided locks where possible.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.Create
member.summary: Creates a new
member.returns: A new

member.name: P:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.IsAcquired
member.summary: Returns true if the lock is acquired, else false

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.Enter(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Enter the lock. If this method returns, will be true. If an exception occurs, will indicate whether the lock was taken and needs to be released using . This method may never exit
member.param: A reference to a bool that indicates whether the lock is taken. Must be false when passed, else the internal state or return state may be corrupted. If the method returns, this is guaranteed to be true

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.TryEnter(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Enter the lock if it not acquired, else, do not. will be true if the lock was taken, else false. If is true, must be called to release it, else, it must not be called
member.param: A reference to a bool that indicates whether the lock is taken. Must be false when passed, else the internal state or return state may be corrupted

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.TryEnter(System.Boolean@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Try to safely enter the lock a certain number of times (). will be true if the lock was taken, else false. If is true, must be called to release it, else, it must not be called
member.param: A reference to a bool that indicates whether the lock is taken. Must be false when passed, else the internal state or return state may be corrupted
The number of attempts to acquire the lock before returning without the lock

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.TryEnter(System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Try to safely enter the lock for a certain (). will be true if the lock was taken, else false. If is true, must be called to release it, else, it must not be called
member.param: A reference to a bool that indicates whether the lock is taken. Must be false when passed, else the internal state or return state may be corrupted
The to attempt to acquire the lock for before returning without the lock. A negative will cause undefined behaviour

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.Exit
member.summary: Exit the lock. This method is dangerous and must be called only once the caller is sure they have ownership of the lock.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.Exit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exit the lock with an optional post-release memory barrier. This method is dangerous and must be called only once the caller is sure they have ownership of the lock.
member.param: Whether a memory barrier should be inserted after the release

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.BreakneckLock.ExitWithBarrier
member.summary: Exit the lock with a post-release memory barrier. This method is dangerous and must be called only once the caller is sure they have ownership of the lock.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.Native.SilkMarshal.DelegateToPtr(System.Delegate,Silk.NET.Core.Native.DelegatePointerKind,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a function pointer for the given delegate.
member.param: The delegate to get a function pointer to.

The method by which SilkMarshal should retrieve the pointer. If , the pointer is retrieved using 's which will generate an unmanaged-to-managed transition runtime stub. This may have some overhead, but is critical if you want to pass this pointer to native code. If this pointer is not being sent to native code, and you just want to use this delegate as a managed function pointer, may be used which will return a function pointer directly to the method instead of going through an unmanaged stub. The method represented by the delegate must be static, however.
Whether to pin the delegate such that the returned pointer remains valid for long periods of time.
member.returns: A function pointer to the given delegate.

member.name: M:Silk.NET.Core.Native.SilkMarshal.DelegateToCdecl(System.Delegate,Silk.NET.Core.Native.DelegatePointerKind,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a function pointer for the given delegate using the __cdecl calling convention.
member.param: The delegate to get a function pointer to.
The method by which SilkMarshal should retrieve the pointer. Should always be except in very rare edge cases.
Whether to pin the delegate such that the returned pointer remains valid for long periods of time.
Whether to skip validity checks, such as calling convention mismatch checks.
member.returns: A function pointer to the given delegate.

Whether to skip validity checks, such as calling convention mismatch checks.
member.returns: A function pointer to the given delegate.
